Tauranga GPs working evenings, weekends as workload demands continue to rise https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/tauranga-gps-working-evenings-weekends-as-workload-demands-continue-to-rise/67U4MUGODBANBDJVSTYCCFJIGU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/tauranga-gps-working-evenings-weekends-as-workload-demands-continue-to-rise/67U4MUGODBANBDJVSTYCCFJIGU/ Megan WilsonGPs say time for non-clinical work needs to be 'recognised' and 'remunerated'. Locals take out top prizes at Northland’s Ninety Mile Beach Snapper Bonanza https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/locals-take-out-top-prizes-at-northlands-ninety-mile-beach-snapper-bonanza/HBZ2CIBODRF53CGU53XDW4D7QA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/locals-take-out-top-prizes-at-northlands-ninety-mile-beach-snapper-bonanza/HBZ2CIBODRF53CGU53XDW4D7QA/ Mike DinsdaleNinety Mile Beach Snapper Bonanza delivers success for local fishers. Sun, 17 Mar 2024 21:44:45 +0000 Kaitāia’s Zane Kaaka with the 8.225kg snapper that won him a total of $32,500 as the heaviest fish caught at the annual Ninety Mile Beach Snapper Bonanza. Pictured with him are bonanza organisers Dave Collard and John Stewart.

Tā Mason Durie reflects on advances in Māori Health over the past four decades https://www.nzherald.co.nz/kahu/ta-mason-durie-reflects-on-advances-in-maori-health-over-the-past-four-decades/4VRF55DHPFD2TPEK6Y7YWADCFU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/kahu/ta-mason-durie-reflects-on-advances-in-maori-health-over-the-past-four-decades/4VRF55DHPFD2TPEK6Y7YWADCFU/ "We must adjust to this new landscape and prepare for the next 40 years.” Sun, 17 Mar 2024 20:51:18 +0000 Tā Mason Durie has spent his life fighting and advocating fiercely for hauora Māori.
